onyomiExamples.meaning: morning meal (for priests, monks, etc.), food offering at a Buddhist ceremony

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to eat, to live, to make a living, to survive, to bite, to sting (as insects do), to tease, to torment, to taunt, to make light of, to make fun of, to encroach on, to eat into, to consume, to defeat a superior, to threaten a position, to consume time and-or resources, to receive something (usu. an unfavourable event), to have sexual relations with a woman, esp. for the first time
(living) from hand to mouth, living on the fringe of subsistence
to eat, to drink, to wolf, to knock back, to receive (e.g. a blow), to be on the receiving end (of something undesirable), to undergo (trouble)
to eat, to live on (e.g. a salary), to live off, to subsist on
chili oil mixed with chopped garlic, onions, etc.
to eat (fodder, grass, etc.), to receive (a salary), to receive a stipend from one's lord
